p: For Co-, Ni-, and Mn-based batteries, the leaching power of HCl is high enough; therefore, a reducing agent is not necessary. From the literature reviewed, only two authors had used H 2O 2 as a reducing agent [ 162, 163]. The resulted Li and Co recoveries (83% for both) obtained by Shuva et al. [ 163] were even lower than those in other studies without a reducing agent (for example, almost 100% for Li and Co) [ 129]. Takacova et al. demonstrated that HCl leaching in the absence of H 2O 2 presents a two-step kinetic, controlled first by the chemical reaction rate of cobalt ( Ea = 40–48 kJ/mol) followed by a mixed control process ( Ea = 20–26 kJ/mol) [ 129]. The latter activation energy value is similar to that obtained for cobalt by Shuva et al. [ 163].
